Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
gosh interesting chat about haskell, yes need more haskellers.   got an enquiry about a project from eth->kmd on the grapevine.  2nd one in a month.

but to the channel topic, over xmas i dabbled with a bit of miningrigrentals to see the state of mining other coins, and tried out zpool (i like it!) after getting sick of blackjoker's zex  pool not accepting an inno 50k overclocked thing and leto's polly having very low ARRR hashrate.

what i discovered was the way pool operators in this ecosystem allow the links from the worker tabs to see what a miner has earned is handy.   the digihash.io pool of digibyte disable this, presumably to protect miners.

also, 1 minute blocktimes are pretty good for miners.   the 2-10minute blocktimes is not cool for 3 hour mining contract experiments 😃

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo FYI it's jeezy that runs the polly pool

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo i haven't used many different pools, but LuckPool has one of the most polished UI's with really nice earning stats, that I have seen

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: such as the Earnings tab here (which is not my miner): https://luckpool.net/verus/miner.html?REhbQPJJdpAW1MZyKZ4BzYkNZPPJ7vvhj5

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
